alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:24PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jasper, eastern Newton, northwestern Clarke and Lauderdale Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 224 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Zero to near Rose Hill. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Zero and Increase around 230 PM CDT. Marion, Toomsuba and Meehan around 245 PM CDT. Lauderdale, Meridian Station, Duffee, Suqualena and Nellieburg around 300 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
